friction_points.description: mlld validate command fails with 'Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'body' in llm' when validating exe llm syntax, but the same syntax works in test fixtures and matches spec examples
friction_points.suggested_fix: This appears to be a parser issue specific to standalone .mld files vs test fixtures. The syntax is correct according to tests and spec. Consider investigating why standalone validation differs from fixture testing.

chestertons_fence.current_behavior: mlld validate fails on exe llm @name syntax in standalone files
chestertons_fence.possible_reason: The validator may use a different parsing mode or context than the test runner, or exe labels feature may not be fully integrated with standalone file validation
chestertons_fence.change_impact: Would enable developers to validate security examples locally before running full test suite
